resource.name: Transit Pass-ups
resource.description:
A pass-up occurs when a bus is too full to allow any additional passengers to board a bus. Passengers are “passed-up” and must wait at the bus stop for the next scheduled bus.

This data is recorded by the bus’s on-board computer whenever a bus operator pushes a button to log when a pass-up occurs.
columns_description: The time at which the button was pressed to record a pass-up.
The location at which the button was pressed to record a pass-up.

resource.name: Snow Parking Bans
resource.description: Updated list of Snow Parking Bans in effect.  Used in conjunction with the Plow Zone Schedule dataset located at https://data.winnipeg.ca/dataset/Plow-Zone-Schedule/tix9-r5tc

resource.name: Council Member Expenses
resource.description: Expenses of City Council Members. Records begin Jan 1, 2014.

resource.name: City Of Winnipeg Population
resource.description: Historical and Forecast population levels for the City of Winnipeg and the City of Winnipeg CMA. City of Winnipeg forecast population is based on a regression of relative growth rates between the City and the surrounding Census Metropolitan Area.

resource.name: Electoral Wards (2014-2018)
resource.description: This dataset contains electoral wards as polygons and councillor information for the 2014 to 2018 term.  These wards no longer represent the wards of Winnipeg.

resource.name: Census - Aboriginal People
resource.description: The identity and ancestry of aboriginal people living in neighbourhoods, neighbourhood clusters, wards, community areas, and custom areas including downtown and the entire city.

resource.name: COVID-19 By-law Enforcement
resource.description:
This data set shows the daily COVID-19 enforcement activities undertaken by the City’s Community Service Ambassadors and By-Law Enforcement Officers in City-owned parks and open spaces. This data comes from daily reports compiled by the Community Services Department. Positive interactions means positive reinforcement of citizen behavior that is consistent with the Public health order for physical distancing.  

From June 3 2021 to June 25 2021, the number of parks patrolled attribute includes spray pads.

For more information on the City’s response to COVID-19, see: https://winnipeg.ca/COVID-19.
columns_description: closed facilities warnings (verbal)
social distancing warnings (verbal)
positive interactions
large group warnings (verbal)
parks patrolled
tickets issued

resource.name: Aggregate Building Permit Data
resource.description: Aggregate construction values for building permits, divided by year, neighbourhood and permit type (commercial vs non-commercial).  Any row with a single permit count has it's construction value removed, to maintain privacy for permit holders. These rows are then summed into a row with a neighbourhood of 'WINNIPEG OMITTED CONSTRUCTION VALUE'.  The location is a centre point of the indicated neighbourhood.  To see details of building permits (without construction value) please visit https://data.winnipeg.ca/Development-Approvals-Building-Permits-Inspections/Detailed-Building-Permit-Data/it4w-cpf4/data

resource.name: Fippa Request Responses
resource.description:
The Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act (FIPPA) provides for the legal right of access to records held by the City of Winnipeg and protects privacy and personal information by limiting the ways that the City can collect, use, and disseminate personal information. 

As part of its commitment to greater transparency and accountability, the City of Winnipeg publishes details of applications received for access to records under Part 2 of FIPPA. Responses to the applications are posted unless the application was for personal information, or was abandoned, withdrawn, or transferred. 

FIPPA sets out the exclusions and exceptions to disclosure, as well as the other statutes that prevail over FIPPA (http://web2.gov.mb.ca/laws/statutes/ccsm/f175e.php). When an exclusion, exception, or other statute is relied upon to refuse access, the response letter to the applicant includes the section number from the legislation (e.g. section 17 or s.17). The most commonly cited sections are as follows:

s.5	Conflict with another act 
s.10	Access to records in electronic form
s.12	Record does not exist or cannot be located; refusal to confirm or deny existence of record 
s.13	Public body may disregard certain requests 
s.17	Disclosure harmful to a third party's privacy 
s.18	Disclosure harmful to a third party's business interests 
s.19	Cabinet confidences 
s.20	Information provided by another government to department or government agency 
s.21	Disclosure harmful to relations between Manitoba and other governments 
s.22	Local public body confidences 
s.23	Advice to a public body 
s.24	Disclosure harmful to individual or public safety 
s.25	Disclosure harmful to law enforcement or legal proceedings 
s.26	Disclosure harmful to security of property 
s.27	Solicitor-client privilege 
s.28	Disclosure harmful to economic and other interests of a public body 
s.29	Testing procedures, tests and audits 
s.29.1	Disclosure harmful to public body’s labour relations
s.29.2	Information relating to workplace investigations
s.30	Confidential evaluations about the applicant 
s.31	Disclosure harmful to preservation of heritage resources and life forms 
s.32	Information that will be available to the public

Sections 29.1 and 29.2 were added as new exceptions to disclosure as part of the 2022 amendments to FIPPA.

resource.name: Insect Control - Helicopter Flight Spray

resource.name: James Avenue River Levels
resource.description: Record of James Ave. river levels. Values are in James feet. Daily river elevations recorded at 7 a.m. CST. Please see James Avenue datum http://winnipeg.ca/waterandwaste/drainageFlooding/riverlevels/thisYear.stm for more details.

resource.name: 311 Performance Metric - Service Request vs Information Request
Narcan Administrations
resource.description:
Total incidents where Narcan(Naloxone) was administered to a patient 1 or more times. Each record represents one patient.
Note: 'Incident Number' can appear more than once as each Incident Number can have more than one unique patient (identified by 'Patient Number').

resource.name: Annual Citizen Satisfaction Survey
resource.description:
Six hundred Winnipeg residents were randomly surveyed by telephone by an external research company. Adjusted quota sampling methodology is used to improve representation by gender and age, and an additional quota of 27% inner city residents is applied to ensure geographic representation of this group.
The survey results are provided with a margin of error of +/-4.1% to a 95% confidence level (19 times
out of 20). Data is based on results from citizens who answered each survey question. 
Open-ended responses are reviewed to ensure no personal information is included.
columns_description: Full text of response given to question
Uniquely identifies a response to a survey question. If null, response was open ended
Additional information related to the question asked
Verbatim question asked to survey respondent
Uniquely identifies respondent for a given year's survey
Uniquely identifies a survey question for a given year's survey
Year survey was performed

resource.name: Province of Manitoba - Potential COVID-19 Exposures
resource.description:
This dataset lists locations where people might have been exposed to COVID-19 in a City of Winnipeg facility or vehicle, including Winnipeg Transit and Winnipeg Transit Plus. The information in this dataset is taken directly from the Manitoba Health website (http://www.manitoba.ca/covid19/restartmb/prs/winnipeg/index.html#exposure) , and updated daily by 4 p.m. as required.

Residents are reminded that if they are showing symptoms of COVID-19, they are advised to visit a testing site as soon as possible. Those who have concerns about symptoms or who are unsure whether they should be tested can call Health Links-Info Santé at 204-788-8200 or toll free at 1-888-315-9257. For the most up-to-date information related to COVID-19, visit: http://www.manitoba.ca/covid19.

resource.name: Council Data
resource.description: Data pertaining to City Council members and their wards. Updated each election year with data on new set of Council members.

resource.name: Bicycle Permanent Station Counts
resource.description: This dataset comprises cyclist counts collected at the City of Winnipeg’s permanent count stations. Each station utilizes an inductive loop sensor, which detects metal from bicycle wheels (rims) as they pass over the sensor and disturb the electromagnetic field.

resource.name: Vehicle For Hire Contravention
resource.description:
Monthly Vehicle for Hire Contravention - tickets issued by Vehicle For Hire enforcement officers for any violations of the bylaw 129/2017.
The fine amounts in the data set identify both the full fine and early payment discount (fine owing if paid early) at the time the violation was issued.

resource.name: Orthographic Photography Index for Winnipeg
resource.description: List of high resolution orthographic photos of the City of Winnipeg.  This list includes links to the single file mosaic, or to the dataset that includes the tiles for the appropriate year, from 2005 to 2016 ongoing.  The size column is in gigabytes.  The file format is .ecw.

resource.name: LRS Block Segments
resource.description:
This dataset is an LRS event to be used in conjunction with the base LRS geometries at https://data.winnipeg.ca/d/jwfi-vjqw/data, the Location column provided is a dynamic segmentation of the event based on the LRS geometries.

This event provides information on the street classifications, address ranges, number of lanes, and direction of City of Winnipeg streets. 

Values for the Oneway column are as follows:
0 – The street is a two-way street
1 – The one-way direction is opposite the digitized direction
2 – The one-way direction is the same as the digitized direction
columns_description: Further categorizes different parts of the same street. For example, segments in a roundabout could have a Street Qualifier of "A" and a Street Qualifier Secondary of "Traffic Circle"

Designates what direction traffic flows along the segment. 0 = two way street. 1 = one way street in the opposite direction of the segment's geometry. 2 = one way street in the same direction as the segment's geometry

resource.name: Traffic Signal Inventory - Corridor Boxes Detail
resource.description:
Information on flashing pedestrian corridors. Provides info on size and number of flashing pedestrian corridor boxes.  Signal Location Number is based on general point location data from the Traffic Signals Inventory – Locations.  Point data in dataset maps to the specific pole location that supports this component. This data may change periodically.
Parent Component to Traffic Signal Inventory – Corridor Box Indications Detail Component ID

This data is provided by the Province of Manitoba as a pilot Open Data program between the city and the province - the data is available here: http://www.edu.gov.mb.ca/k12/finance/sch_enrol/

resource.name: Rooming House Enforcement Activity
resource.description: This dataset comprises of illegal rooming house enforcement incident counts and the status of investigation counts collected by the City of Winnipeg. The neigbourhoods will only be listed if an investigation was opened.  Multiple complaints on one property within a short period of time are investigated as one incident.

resource.name: 311 Call Wait Times
resource.description: Caller wait time and call talk times for the 311 contact centre. Each row is the value for the average of the last 30 minutes of caller wait time and call talk time.

resource.name: Lobbyist Registry
resource.description:
On April 26, 2017 Council approved the implementation of a voluntary lobbyist registry. The purpose of the registry is to provide transparency on lobbying activities in the City of Winnipeg

Lobbyists are not required by legislation to register their activities; however registration on a voluntary basis is encouraged in order to enhance the transparency and integrity of business conducted.

resource.name: Gift Registry
resource.description:
On February 22, 2018 Council adopted the Code of Conduct for Members of Council. The purpose of the Code is to establish and promote ethical conduct standards which are essential to the fair and effective operation of government.

Council Members must provide the Integrity Commissioner with a quarterly Disclosure Statement identifying the receipt of any gift or benefit connected to the performance of the Member’s duties of office. These statements are a matter of public record.

resource.name: Detailed Development Permit Data
resource.description: City of Winnipeg development permits issued since November, 14, 2022, containing most information about the permit. For definitions of the development permit status, please see https://ppdportal.winnipeg.ca/Permits/PropertyPermitSearch/SearchFAQ.jsp

resource.name: Census 2001 - Marital Status
resource.description: The marital status of people living in neighbourhoods, neighbourhood clusters, wards, community areas, and custom areas including downtown and the entire city.

resource.name: WFPS Call Logs
resource.description:
The data set will list every call the WFPS has responded to between 2015 to present, which units responded, whether it was a medical emergency or fire/rescue call, when the incident resolved, whether it involved a vehicular collision, and which neighbourhood and electoral ward it took place in.  The data is based on the calls received, which may not necessitate a unit being sent as additional information is provided.  

The units can be broken down as follows: 

Medical -
DC: District Chief 
EPIC: Emergency Paramedics in the Community Unit
MIRV: Major Incident Response Unit
PACE: Non Motorized Unit
PTRS: Special Assignment Unit 
##: Ambulance Unit

Fire Rescue -
ATV: Special Rescue
BN: Special Rescue
CV: Special Rescue
D: District Chief
DCT: Special Rescue
E: Engine/Pumper
FI: Fire Investigator
GA: Gator
GEN: Special Rescue
HM: Hazmat
L: Ladder
P: Platoon Chief
R: Rescue
RU: Special Rescue
S: Platoon Safety Officer
SN: Special Rescue
SQ: Squad
T: Special Rescue
TC: Special Rescue
W: Water Rescue
WERU: Special Rescue
WL: Special Rescue

resource.name: Traffic Signal Inventory - Bases Detail
resource.description: Information about Traffic Signal pole and cabinet bases. Signal Location Number is based on general point location data from the Traffic Signals Inventory – Locations.  Point data in dataset maps to the specific pole or cabinet base location that supports this component. This data may change periodically.

resource.name: Housing Permit Inspection Statistics
resource.description: Annual number of housing permits issued, inspections performed, and defects recorded
